actor_awards.notes: Best known as the voice of the nearsighted cartoon character Mr. Magoo and as the wealthy Thurston Howell III on the television series Gilligan's Island. He received a Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame for Television in 1960.

filmography.title: Rebel Without a Cause
filmography.role_description: The weak-willed, apron-wearing father of James Dean's character, whose lack of authority drives his son's rebellion.
filmography.plot: A rebellious young man with a troubled past comes to a new town, finding friends and enemies.

filmography.title: It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World
filmography.role_description: A drunk, wealthy airplane owner who is coerced into flying Mickey Rooney and Buddy Hackett to the treasure.
filmography.plot: A dying thief reveals the location of stolen cash to a group of strangers, sparking a chaotic cross-country race to find the loot.

filmography.title: Pat and Mike
filmography.role_description: The domineering fiancé of Katharine Hepburn's character who wants her to give up her athletic career.
filmography.plot: A spectacular female athlete engages a shady sports promoter as her manager, leading to romance and professional success.

filmography.title: His Kind of Woman
filmography.role_description: An investment broker and avid card player staying at a Mexican resort who gets caught up in a gangster's plot.
filmography.plot: A deported gangster plans to re-enter the USA by assuming the identity of a gambler, but his plan hits a snag.

filmography.title: Don't Bother to Knock
filmography.role_description: A hotel guest who becomes a target of the mentally unstable Nell Forbes, played by Marilyn Monroe.
filmography.plot: A pilot tries to win back his former girlfriend while dealing with a mentally unstable babysitter at the same hotel.

filmography.title: I Want to Live!
filmography.role_description: The journalist who covers the trial of Barbara Graham and eventually becomes convinced of her innocence.
filmography.plot: The biographical story of a woman with a criminal past who is accused of murder and faces the death penalty.

filmography.title: Angel Face
filmography.role_description: The prosecutor who tries the case against the manipulative Diane Tremayne.
filmography.plot: An ambulance driver is pursued by a beautiful but dangerous young woman with a plan to murder her stepmother.

filmography.title: Mister Magoo's Christmas Carol
filmography.role_description: The voice of the nearsighted Mr. Magoo playing Scrooge in this beloved animated musical adaptation. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: An animated retelling of Charles Dickens' classic tale, with the nearsighted Mr. Magoo starring as Ebenezer Scrooge.

filmography.title: Pete's Dragon
filmography.role_description: The pompous mayor of the seaside town where Pete and his dragon Elliot cause trouble.
filmography.plot: An orphan boy and his magical dragon come to town and help a lighthouse keeper and her daughter.

filmography.title: Man of a Thousand Faces
filmography.role_description: A press agent and friend to Lon Chaney in this biopic of the silent film horror star.
filmography.plot: The life story of Lon Chaney, the actor known for his transformative makeup and roles in silent horror films.

filmography.title: Deadline - U.S.A.
filmography.role_description: A reporter for 'The Day' newspaper working under Humphrey Bogart's editor character.
filmography.plot: A crusade-minded editor tries to keep his newspaper from being sold while exposing a gangster's crimes.

filmography.title: Above and Beyond
filmography.role_description: The tough general who oversees the training of the unit destined to drop the atomic bomb.
filmography.plot: The story of Colonel Paul Tibbets, the pilot who dropped the atomic bomb on Hiroshima, and the strain the secret mission took on his marriage.

filmography.title: Francis in the Navy
filmography.role_description: A befuddled naval commander dealing with the antics of Donald O'Connor and a talking mule.
filmography.plot: An army lieutenant gets mistaken for a navy bosun's mate and has to deal with his talking mule while trying to clear up the confusion.

filmography.title: 1001 Arabian Nights
filmography.role_description: The voice of Mr. Magoo in this animated feature retelling of the Aladdin story.
filmography.plot: The nearsighted Mr. Magoo plays an uncle to Aladdin in this animated twist on the classic Arabian Nights tale.

filmography.title: The Wonderful World of the Brothers Grimm
filmography.role_description: The King in 'The Dancing Princess', one of the fairy tale segments within the biographical film.
filmography.plot: The story of Wilhelm and Jacob Grimm and three of their stories: The Dancing Princess, The Cobbler and the Elves, and The Singing Bone.

filmography.title: Ice Palace
filmography.role_description: A cannery foreman and rival in this multi-generational saga set in Alaska.
filmography.plot: Two men, a salmon baron and a would-be politician, battle for control of Alaska's future over the course of forty years.

filmography.title: Sunday in New York
filmography.role_description: The boss of the main character, a pilot played by Cliff Robertson.
filmography.plot: A young woman visiting her brother in New York City is determined to lose her virginity but finds romance instead.

filmography.title: Rescue from Gilligan's Island
filmography.role_description: Reprising his famous TV role as the millionaire stranded on an island. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: The castaways finally get off the island, but they have trouble adjusting to life back in civilization.

filmography.title: Now You See Him, Now You Don't
filmography.role_description: The bank president in this Disney comedy about invisibility.
filmography.plot: A chemistry student discovers an invisibility spray, which a crook tries to steal to rob a bank.

filmography.title: Advance to the Rear
filmography.role_description: A Union general in this Civil War comedy.
filmography.plot: A Union company of misfits is sent to the West to keep them out of trouble, but they end up capturing a Confederate spy.

filmography.title: Hurry Sundown
filmography.role_description: A lawyer involved in a land dispute in the post-WWII South.
filmography.plot: Two cousins fight over a plot of land in 1946 Georgia, facing racial tensions and corporate greed.

filmography.title: Hello Down There
filmography.role_description: The boss of Tony Randall's character who demands he prove his underwater home concept works.
filmography.plot: A scientist convinces his family to live in an underwater home for thirty days to prove it is viable.

filmography.title: The Great Man
filmography.role_description: A publicity man involved in the aftermath of a famous radio host's death.
filmography.plot: A reporter investigates the life of a beloved radio host after his death, discovering he was actually a despicable person.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Nomination – Best Foreign Actor (Jose Ferrer)

filmography.title: Where Were You When the Lights Went Out?
filmography.role_description: A car salesman in this comedy set during the 1965 Northeast blackout.
filmography.plot: The lives of several New Yorkers collide during the massive power outage of 1965.

filmography.title: A Big Hand for the Little Lady
filmography.role_description: One of the high-stakes poker players in this western comedy.
filmography.plot: A family traveling west stops for a poker game, where the husband bets their life savings, leading his wife to take his place.
